oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The use of a dual-challenge Bovine Viral Diarrhea Virus-Mannheimia haemolytica model to compare vaccine efficacy in calves in the face of maternal immunity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Perkins-Oines, S.
Krafsur, G.
Adelsalam, K.
Ensley, D.
Jones, C.
Chase, C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine respiratory disease continues to be the greatest threat to calf health. One of the common recommendations is to vac足cinate young beef and dairy calves at 30-60 days of age to pro足vide protection at weaning or when commingled. A study was designed to determine if vaccination in the face of maternal an足tibody would provide protection against a dual challenge with bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) and Mannheimia haemolyti足ca ~5 months after vaccination.
